OriginalSource.Creator: Terese Winslow
OriginalSource.Comment: Changed the label “Cerclage band” to “Cerclage stitch” and changed the color of the band to black so that it is more in line with the typical color of stitches.

In the R image, removed the entire lower portion of the cervix and moved the band up so that it's around the ‘lower part of the uterus’; also showed more of the body of the uterus; in the L image, changed the label to "Pelvic cavity" instead of "Abdominal cavity"

Switched the placement of the two image panels so that the normal cervix is shown in the left image panel; for the image panel on the right, showed a cervix that has been removed; in the left panel, faded the top of the uterus and moved the Uterus label down over the bottom tip of the uterus (to avoid showing where a pregnancy might exist so as not to detract from the main focus of the image); and the removed the labels Transabdominal and Transvaginal

ContentDescriptions.ContentDescription: Two-panel drawing showing a cervical cerclage; the panel on the left shows the uterus and the cervix with a cerclage stitch around it. Also shown is the external OS (the opening between the cervix and vagina), the vagina, and part of the pelvic cavity. The panel on the right shows the lower part of the cervix removed and a cerclage stitch around the lower end of the uterus.

Captions.MediaCaption: Cervical cerclage. A special stitch is placed around the cervix to help keep it closed during a pregnancy (left panel). If the cervix has been removed by surgery, the stitch is placed on the lower end of the uterus (right panel).

ProcessingStatus.ProcessingStatusValue: Approved by expert reviewer with changes

ProcessingStatus.Comment: Sent to Larissa Meyer, M.D. for review
